original_title: Sri Lanka’s CoPF summons CB, banks, EPF over DDR
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s Committee on Public Finance has summoned key agencies linked to debt re-structuring, over a debt restructuring plan, its chair Harsha de Silva said.
The Central Bank of Sri Lanka, Ministry of Finance, Banks and Employment Provident Fund has been summoned to for a meeting on June 29.
“On Friday 30 we will meet again together to resolve outstanding issues,” de Silva said in twitter.com messages.

We summoned @CBSL, Min of Fin, AG for first session n banks, EPF etc for second session tomorrow 29 to #CoPF @ParliamentLK to discuss proposed Dom Debt Restructure. On Friday 30 we will meet again together to resolve outstanding issues. Looking forward to constructive sessions. pic.twitter.com/OQQpJTj6CJ
Sri Lanka’s cabinet of ministers are due to meet on the debt plan later on Wednesday.
Sri Lanka’s Speaker has convened parliament on July 01 to consider the debt restructuring plan which involves both domestic and external debt. (Colombo/June28/2023)
